title: Value for money in a quiet street
text:
The Cordellats is great if you would like to step off the noise of the main streets for a little bit.

It's small and cosy and offers good food for a decent price. We ate the day menu which includes salad, paella and sangria for EUR 12.00 per pax, so it's very budget-friendly.

title: The view is worth the climb
text:
We underestimated the climb up - there are 120+ stairs so be prepared and bring some water.

The reward once you climb up is worth it - an astonishing 360-degree view of Valencia.

It's only EUR 2.00, so it's a little money well spent

title: Must see spot in the heart of the old city
text:
Plaza de la Virgen is possibly the most beautiful spot in old-town Valencia - you are surrounded by picturesque buildings, a glourious fountain and cosy little cafés.

If you only have a couple of hours in Valencia, this is the must-go place.

title: Great start to explore Valencia
text:
We took the tour with Amparo - she was very informative and gave fun plenty of fun Valencian trivia.

The tour should probably be the start of your trip to Valencia as there is plenty more to see beyond that.

title: Favourite vacation spot
text:
We have been staying in a caravan in Tsitreli for the years in a row. Nina ans Giannis are absolutely amazing - most of the people who stay in Tsitreli keep on returning (same as us).

The rented caravans include a fully equipped kitchenette (fridge, oven, cutlery, plates, etc.), as well as a table and 4 chairs outide the caravan. You can request a barbeque to your caravan. They provide you with sheets and towels and even offer a change every 3 days - this is something unseen as compared to other camps that make you bring your own sheets. The shared bathrooms get cleaned on daily basis.

The campsite is 50 m away from the beach and a waking distance from restaurants and cafes. The camp has its own supermarket.

title: Nice secluded beach
text: We have been visiting this beach in late May / early June and it is a perfect secluded spot - there are no more than 10 people on the beach at a time. The beach is sandy and the water is clean, however it can get rather windy. It offers a great view to Aton.

title: Great food, great people
text: Zorbas offers a variety of seafood and Greek national dishes. Everything is extremely delicious and the staff is great (also multilingual).I recommend tsipura fish on grill with a glass of ouzo ;)

title: Okay to visit
text:
The Sarafkina House is in the middle of the picturesque Gurko Str. It is an old house turned into a museums which offers and insight to 19th rich Bulgarian house.

Only two out of five floors are open to visitors. The exhibition shows a variety of everyday objects, furniture, national clothing, old photographs. It's not too grand but still a lovely place to see.

It takes approx. 30 mins to tour and is definitely worth the huble price of EUR 3.00. per pax.

title: Good for a stroll
text:
For those who would like to feel the authentic 19th century revolutionary Veliko Turnovo. The street is surrounded by renovated houses used as shops or galleries.

It leads staright to Tsarevets Fortress.

title: Best restaurant
text:
This is the best restaurant in Veliko Turnovo - if offers a bit of a twist to the authentic cusine and delicious variety of meals.

Great view, too.

title: An important historical landmark
text:
The Tsarevets Fortress is one of the most important historical monuments in Bulgaria and of the very few castles we Bulgarians have - in this sense, it is a crutial historical landmark and a must-see.

I'd personally recommend to visit in spring due to all the blossoming trees (it looks a bit bare in winter).

You can spend a few hours just hiking the hill.

title: Best pizza in Sofia!
text: Franco's Pizza is officially the best pizza place in Sofia! It is small and cosy with friendly staff and the pizza is to die for - thin, yet juicy.

title: Must visit!
text:
The Acropolis museum is located below the Acropolis hill and holds a splendid collection of sculptures and murals.

Bonus: it's very well air conditioned, so it's a great place to catch your breath after hiking on the Acropolis hill.

title: Must-see!
text:
The Acropolis is a must-see historical place - it is unique with its history and has great view of the rest of the city.

The entrance for the Acropolis is EUR 20.00 which we found quite steep in comparison to the city standart. A tourist guide joked that the Greeks had to pay their external debt somehow, thus the high fee :)

Don't forget to bring water and wear a cap.

title: You get what you (don't) pay for
text:
Well, you get what you pay for - if you want a cheap stay in within walking distance from everything, then this is the place for you but don't expect more than this.

It's noisy, not too clean and our bathroom was a transparent additon in the actual room, not a seperate room.

Staff was nice though.

title: Peace and quiet in the city
text: A lovely park to either go for a stroll or a bike ride and get away from the city noise. Great for all ages!

title: Very organised
text: I think this is one of the most organised train stations ever! It takes 15 mins to get from the airport to Amsterdam Centraal.

title: Cool place
text: We visited the Banksy and Ice & Sot exhibition. It was very inspirational and edgy. Well worth the time and money.

title: Lovely
text:
I'm a person with limited art knowledge but the museum is very nice even for art dummies with plenty of infortmation written down.

The special collection is a must-see along with The Night Watch and Waterloo.

Recommended time: 3-4 hours (maybe even 5)

title: Great location, worth the cash.
text:
Stayokay is perfect if you would like a modest palce to stay in the heart of the city - 15 min walk from Amsterdam Centraal (direct connection to airport) and walking distance from all the main attractions.

Pros: location, clean, surprisingly quiet

Cons: disorganised - it seems that every night staff had to come and wake up people to check if they are on the correct bed (thus waking everybody up and making a hassle) which was quite annoying

Recommendation to staff: Just make sure people are on the right beds when they check in, not at 3 a.m.

title: Absolutely amazing!
text: The tour with Charlotte was absolutely amazing - very informative, fun and witty at times. We loved it!
